#summary Tutorial.

= Dependencies =

  * jquery.core 
  * jquery.ui.core.js
  * jquery.ui.widget.js


= Overview =

Make the selected element a Google map.

{{{
$(document).ready(function() {				
    $('#map_canvas').map();
});
}}}


= Options =
see http://code.google.com/intl/sv-SE/apis/maps/documentation/javascript/reference.html#MapOptions


= Methods =

===addMarker(latitude, longitude, options)===
Adds a marker to the map. 

===loadJSON(url, data)===
Loads markers by a JSON request

===loadHTML(cssClass, semanticType)===
Loads markers by HTML. The HTML must be sprinkled with RDFa, Microformats or Microdata to render accurately.

===loadDirections(origin, destination, travelMode, panel)===
Displays directions on map and in panel

===clearMarkers()===
Clears all markers


= Example =

{{{
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
    <head>
        <script type="text/javascript" src="http://maps.google.com/maps/api/js?sensor=true&amp;language=sv&amp;region=SE"></script>
        <script type="text/javascript" src="http://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.4/jquery.min.js"></script>
        <script type="text/javascript" src="http://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jqueryui/1.8/jquery-ui.min.js"></script>
        <script type="text/javascript" src="../ui/jquery.ui.map.js"></script>
        <script type="text/javascript">
			
            $(document).ready(function() {
                
		var opts = { fallbackInitialLatLon: new google.maps.LatLng(57.7973333, 12.0502107), zoom: 8, mapTypeId: google.maps.MapTypeId.ROADMAP, autoDetectGeoLocation: true, language: 'sv', region: 'se'};
				
		$('#map_canvas').map(opts);
		$('#map_canvas').map('addMarker', 57.7973333, 12.0502107 );

            });
        
        </script>
    </head>
    <body>
    
        <div id="map_canvas" style="width:100%; height:690px;"></div> 

    </body>
</html>
}}}
